article:
'Analytics' is the discovery and communication of meaningful patterns in data.
 Especially valuable in areas rich with recorded information, analytics relies
 on the simultaneous application of statistics, computer programming and
 operations research to quantify performance. Analytics often favors data
 visualization to communicate insight.

Firms may commonly apply analytics to business data, to describe, predict, and
improve business performance. Specifically, arenas within analytics include
enterprise decision management, retail analytics, store assortment and SKU
optimization, marketing optimization and marketing mix analytics, web analytics,
sales force sizing and optimization, price and promotion modeling, predictive
science, credit risk analysis, and fraud analytics. Since analytics can require
extensive computation (See Big Data), the algorithms and software used for
analytics harness the most current methods in computer science, statistics, and
mathematics.
